publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2510 Rosie Kane: Corporate Greed and Scientific Arrogance—That the Parliament condemns the Government of China for moving towards the introduction of biotech rice; believes that President Lula of Brazil should stick to his pre-election promise of not introducing genetically modified organisms (GMOs) in Brazil; considers that governments around the world should listen to the voices of consumers and farmers who overwhelmingly reject the use of GMOs in food production; accepts that GMOs are about ownership, copyright and control of the food chain; rejects the claims of multinationals like Monsanto that genetic engineering will "feed the world", and accepts that the genetic engineering of food is about corporate greed and scientific arrogance. Supported by: Eleanor Scott*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-2510 Corporate Greed and Scientific Arrogance (lodged on 2 March 2005) Tommy Sheridan*

Supported by: Eleanor Scott, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Tommy Sheridan
